text: Gotro is a 2019 Indian Bengali film, directed and produced by Nandita Roy and Shiboprosad Mukherjee . Starring Nigel Akkara, Ambarish Bhattacharya, Saheb Chatterjee, Manali Dey, Badshah Moitra and Anashua Majumdar, it explores the nuances of mother-son relationship. The film was released on 23 August 2019. == Synopsis == Mukti Debi, a staunch Vaishnavite, lives in an old-world mansion named Gobinda Dham while her son, Anirban, lives overseas. Tareq Ali is a former convict who is now trying to redeem himself and restart his life. He is employed by Mukti Debi as the caretaker of her estate. What follows is a tale of how a mother-son relationship begins to build between Mukti Debi and Tareq, while the former is unaware of his Muslim identity, depicting underlying social issues of the era.https://bengali.oneindia.com/movies/reviews/gotro-movie-review-director- duo-nandita-shiboprosad-s-gotro-reveals-story-of-human-religion-060287.html == Cast == * Nigel Akkara as Tareq Ali/Tarak Guha * Ambarish Bhattacharya as a priest * Saheb Chatterjee as Mukti Debi's son, Anirban * Manali Dey as Jhuma * Anashua Majumdar as Mukti Debi * Badhshah Moitra as a police inspector * Kharaj Mukherjee as a real estate promoter * Biswanath Basu in a special appearance in "Mashima Hitler" song == Marketing and release == The official teaser of the film was unveiled by Windows Production on 2 July 2019. The official teaser 2 of the film was unveiled by Windows Production on 17 July 2019. The official trailer of the film was unveiled by Windows Production on 26 July 2019. It was theatrically released on 23 August 2019. ==Soundtrack== The soundtrack is composed by Anindya Chatterjee on his own lyrics. The song "Rangabati" is inspired by the Odiya Song 'Rangabati', composed by Prabhudatta Pradhan on lyrics of Mitrabhanu Gauntia. == References == ==External links== * Category:2019 films Category:Bengali-language films Category:Indian films Category:2010s Bengali-language films
